akn:section.akn:heading: Inquiries into certain arrests, accusations, and convictions.

akn:content.akn:p: An employer may not make an inquiry about or require an applicant to disclose or reveal:
An employer may not make an inquiry about or require an applicant to disclose or reveal a criminal conviction until after making a conditional offer of employment.
The prohibitions of this subchapter shall not apply:

Following the extension of a conditional offer of employment, an employer may only withdraw the conditional offer to an applicant or take an adverse action against an applicant for a legitimate business reason.
